Package org.jtrim2.stream

Class FluentSeqConsumer<T>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.stream.FluentSeqConsumer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements to be processed
public final class FluentSeqConsumer<T> extends Object
Defines a convenient fluent style builder for consumers processing a single sequence of elements. Instances of this class can be created through the toFluent() method of SeqConsumer.

Mutator like methods always return a new instance and do not change the original FluentSeqConsumer instance.

Thread safety

Instances of this class are immutable, and are therefor safe to be used by multiple threads concurrently. This property does not extend to the wrapped SeqConsumer.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent, so they can be called in any context (e.g.: while holding a lock).
See Also:
  • SeqConsumer.toFluent()
  • FluentSeqGroupConsumer

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public <T1> FluentSeqConsumer<T1> apply(Function<? super SeqConsumer<T>,? extends SeqConsumer<T1>> configurer)
      Transforms the wrapped SeqConsumer using the given function and returns a fluent style builder for the transformation result. This method exists to allow fluent style continuation using custom transformations. For example: 
      
 builder
     .apply(SeqConsumer::flatteningConsumer)
     // ...

      For an instance of FluentSeqConsumer named builder, this method call is equivalent to configurer.apply(builder.unwrap()).toFluent().

      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of the elements processed by the returned consumer
      Parameters:
      configurer - the transformation transforming the wrapped consumer. This argument cannot be null, and the transformation cannot return null.
      Returns:
      the wrapped SeqConsumer transformed using the given function as fluent style builder. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • SeqConsumer.flatteningConsumer

    • then

      public <T1 extends T> FluentSeqConsumer<T1> then(SeqConsumer<? super T1> seqConsumer)
      Returns a consumer first applying this consumer for each processed element, then applying the consumer given in the argument.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of the elements processed by the returned consumer
      Parameters:
      seqConsumer - the consumer applied to the processed elements after this consumer. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a consumer first apply this consumer for each processed element, then applying the consumer given in the argument.
      See Also:
      • thenContextFree

    • thenContextFree

      public <T1 extends T> FluentSeqConsumer<T1> thenContextFree(ElementConsumer<? super T1> consumer)
      Returns a consumer first applying this consumer for each processed element, then applying the consumer given in the argument.
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:
      consumer - the consumer applied to the processed elements after this consumer. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a consumer first apply this consumer for each processed element, then applying the consumer given in the argument.
      See Also:
      • then

    • asContextFreeGroupConsumer

      public FluentSeqGroupConsumer<T> asContextFreeGroupConsumer()
      Returns a consumer processing (potentially) multiple sequences using this consumer. That is, each sequence will be processed by the same consumer.

      If this consumer is not stateless, and should not be called for multiple sequences, then consider using the asSingleShotGroupConsumer method for safety.

      Returns:
      a consumer processing (potentially) multiple sequences using this consumer. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • asSingleShotGroupConsumer()

    • asSingleShotGroupConsumer

      public FluentSeqGroupConsumer<T> asSingleShotGroupConsumer()
      Returns a consumer processing a single sequence using this consumer. That is, when processing a group of sequences, the returned consumer will fail, if it was attempted to process multiple sequences.

      Note that the returned consumer is still reusable, that is it can be used for multiple processing, the restriction applies within the context of a single SeqGroupConsumer.consumeAll call.

      Returns:
      a consumer processing a single sequence using this consumer. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • asContextFreeGroupConsumer()

    • unwrap

      public SeqConsumer<T> unwrap()
      Returns the underlying SeqConsumer instance.
      Returns:
      the underlying SeqConsumer instance. This method never returns null.
